Web Developer

Scotch Malt Sales - Tokyo, Japan

Oversaw development of the company e-commerce website. Responsibilities included creating its new-product and promotion pages as well as leveraging its API to give the site customized functionality. Built single-page applications with a serverless architecture using the React framework Gatsby and AWS Lambda. Built an internal application for automating website administration processes with Node.js and Express.

Projects

Kanri

A project management tool prototype

A Kanban project management application that tracks projects and tasks/issues associated with them. A proof-of-ablility project, it could be considered a basic Trello clone.

Live Demo - Free hosting at Heroku takes several seconds to spin up Source Code

CoinSpy

A Cryptocurrency information application

This application leverages the power of the CoinGecko API to deliver numbers and charts for the top 100 cryptocurrencies by market cap. It is a serverless application and makes use of AWS Lambda for back-end functionality and D3.js for data visualization.

Live Demo Source Code

25 + 5 Clock

A freeCodeCamp Front End Libraries Project

This project was a requirement for the freeCodeCamp Front-End Libraries Certification, and even though it's a relatively simple app, this reworking includes a highly efficient implementation of React Hooks, which makes it worthy of being featured here.

Live Demo Source Code

Interests

When indoors, I enjoy reading and writing, particularly philosophy. I also enjoy cooking and when I have something specific in mind, I tend to spend way too many hours online looking for the perfect recipe.

I do outdoor activities when weather permits (and sometimes when it doesn't). I enjoy jogging and cycling, and when I have time I like to go hiking and camping.

As far as technology goes, outside of web development I'm interested in cybersecurity and computer networking.
